definitions.definition: One of the sensations produced by the tongue in response to certain chemicals; the quality of giving this sensation.
definitions.example: He had a strange taste in his mouth.

definitions.definition: The sense that consists in the perception and interpretation of this sensation.
definitions.example: His taste was impaired by an illness.

definitions.definition: A small sample of food, drink, or recreational drugs.
A person's implicit set of preferences, especially esthetic, though also culinary, sartorial, etc.
definitions.example: Dr. Parker has good taste in wine.
I have developed a taste for fine wine.

definitions.definition: A small amount of experience with something that gives a sense of its quality as a whole.
A kind of narrow and thin silk ribbon.
To sample the flavor of something orally.
To have a taste; to excite a particular sensation by which flavour is distinguished.
definitions.example: The chicken tasted great, but the milk tasted like garlic.
I tasted in her arms the delights of paradise.

definitions.definition: To try by eating a little; to eat a small quantity of.
To try by the touch; to handle.
